result.execSummary:
The defendant Jeremy L Kass was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Forgery-Uttering, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.38(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
-Provide DNA sample and pay DNA surcharge during extended supervision; failure to pay shall result ina civil judgment being entered.
-Pay all court costs, fees, and surcharges during extended supervison; failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment being entered.
Concurrent with: with any other sentence being served.

superMiscConds.notes:
- No illegal drugs, no alcohol.
- No contact with victim.

-AODA, cooperate with any and all programs deemed necessary by the Department of Corrections.
-Absolute sobriety, random urine screens.

supervisions.notes: - Defendant is advised he/she is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms. Defendant is advised he/she is unable to vote in any election until civil rights are restored.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jeremy L Kass

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jeremy L Kass not in court.   No Assistant District Attorney Available appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
DEFENDANT IS DECEASED.
ANY FINE/FORFEITURES, COSTS, ASSESSMENTS AND SURCHARGES TO BE WAIVED.
ANY OUTSTANDING CIVIL JUDGMENTS, FINE & COST COMMITMENTS, SUSPENSIONS FOR DRIVING PRIVILEGES TO BE VACATED AND/OR WITHDRAWN.
Proof of death notification received from Department of Corrections on this date and forwarded to Court for review.
Received & Filed, Original PLEA & SENTENCING HEARING Transcript (25 pages) commencing 05/31/2018 by Kristin Menzia.

AS TO COUNT 1:
Defendant Jeremy L Kass in court with attorney Reyna Morales.  Defendant Jeremy L Kass in custody.  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant is advised he/she is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms. Defendant is advised he/she is unable to vote in any election until civil rights are restored. Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen deportation is possible. 

Count 2 is dismissed and read in.

  Sentencing proceeds. Statements made by the State, defense and defendant. 
.
The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 4 YEARS.  INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 2 YEARS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 2 YEARS, concurrent to any other sentence being served.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
-provide DNA sample and pay DNA surcharge during extended supervision; failure to pay shall result ina civil judgment being entered;
-pay all court costs, fees, and surcharges during extended supervison; failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment being entered;
-AODA, cooperate with any and all programs deemed necessary by the Department of Corrections;
-absolute sobriety, no illegal drugs, no alcohol, random urine screens;
-no contact with victim.

Defendant is not eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is not eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.

Appeal rights given. Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence and Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed. Copies given to defendant. -- gmb

Defense just got new offer. 
Case is adjourned to 5-31-18 at 8:30.

Defendant Jeremy L Kass in court with attorney Reyna Morales.  Defendant Jeremy L Kass in custody.  Brandon A Wigley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is requesting a final pretrial and jury trial date.  Final pre-trial scheduled for May 30, 2018 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for June 25, 2019 at 09:00 am.

Attorney Reyna Morales in court, defendant Jeremy L Kass not in court, in custody.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant was not produced from priosn.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for February 27, 2018 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Reyna Morales in court, defendant Jeremy L Kass not in court, in custody.  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 8, 2018 at 01:30 pm.

records.addlTxt: Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Hansher, Branch 42.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.

Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 2 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Jeremy L Kass in court with attorney Reyna Morales.  Defendant Jeremy L Kass in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm

Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.
